intro: Festuca drymeja f. timpae, commonly known as the Alpine meadow fescue, is a subspecies of the fescue grass native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a perennial grass characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Festuca drymeja f. timpae plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
